definition: to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
to unload/to unhitch/to remove or strip/to get rid of

sentences.english: The upper part and lower part are connected by wedge with convenience to disassemble.
sentences.chinese: 上下二部分以楔口的形式相联，脱卸方便。

sentences.english: The two parts by themselves, however, do not constitute an efficient design as no means are incorporated for removing the molding once it is made.
sentences.chinese: 可是这两部分本身并没有设计有效的脱卸塑件的方法。

sentences.english: Zip fastening on inside for ease of use.
sentences.chinese: 采用拉链的闭合方式使穿着或脱卸更加方便。

sentences.english: Zipper pull is not available you should choose gilet.
sentences.chinese: 拉链的拉头应选择不可脱卸。

sentences.english: All the products are adopted by equi ed or easy-removing packing.
sentences.chinese: 所有产品采用整装或脱卸式包装。

sentences.english: It must therefore be removed manually.
sentences.chinese: 因此塑件必须手工脱卸。

sentences.english: Removable Filter Basket lifts out of Brew Basket for quick-and-easy cleaning.
sentences.chinese: 可脱卸的过滤器使你很快很容易地清理。

sentences.english: Multiple height adjustment instrument is equipped (see the figure). Internal feet enable the movement by pushing.
sentences.chinese: 台脚可脱卸，设多重高度调节装置。

sentences.english: The invention provides a dismountable pan handle, belonging to the technical field of cooking utensil.
sentences.chinese: 一种脱卸式的锅提手，属于炊事用具技术领域。

definition: hidden snap fastener (concealed behind a flap on a garment)
a buckle or fastener for clothing that does not use a button and buttonhole (e.g. the buckle on metal wristwatches)
